warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend arms to the sides and make small circles forward for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Slowly rotate your shoulders forward in a circular motion for 30 seconds, then reverse the direction and rotate backward for 30 seconds.
Slowly straighten your arms and lift them until you feel a stretch in your chest. Hold for 15 seconds. Repeat 2 times.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Raise one arm overhead and bend your elbow, letting your hand fall behind your head.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Gently pull your elbow toward your head with your other hand. Hold for 15 seconds. Repeat on the other side. Repeat 2 times.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand with feet together, arms at your sides.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Jump, spreading your legs and raising your arms overhead. Return to starting position. Perform for 1 minute.

exercises.setup: Adjust the machine seat so that your back is firmly supported.  Grab the handles with a slightly wider than shoulder-width grip. Your elbows should be slightly bent at the starting position.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit comfortably on the machine with your back firmly against the backrest. Grab the handles with a slightly wider than shoulder-width grip. Your elbows should be slightly bent.
2. Lower the Handles: Slowly lower the handles towards your chest, keeping your elbows slightly bent and maintaining a controlled movement.  Focus on feeling the stretch in your chest muscles.
3. Press the Handles: Extend your arms to push the handles back to the starting position.  Squeeze your chest muscles at the top of the movement.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and a controlled pace.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 repetitions with good form. Increase the weight in subsequent sets if possible.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width, with an overhand grip.  Lower the bar to your chest.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width, with an overhand grip.  Lower the bar to your chest.
2. Lower the Bar: Slowly lower the barbell to your chest, keeping your elbows slightly bent.  Touch your chest with the bar.
3. Press the Bar: Extend your arms to press the barbell back up to the starting position.  Squeeze your chest muscles at the top of the movement.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and a controlled pace.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 repetitions with good form. Increase the weight in subsequent sets if possible.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on a controlled movement throughout the entire range of motion. Avoid bouncing the weight or using momentum.

exercises.setup: Adjust the bench to an incline of approximately 30-45 degrees. Lie on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on the incline bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other.  Lower the dumbbells to your chest.
2. Lower the Dumbbells: Slowly lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping your elbows slightly bent.  Touch your chest with the dumbbells.
3. Press the Dumbbells: Extend your arms to press the dumbbells back up to the starting position.  Squeeze your chest muscles at the top of the movement.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and a controlled pace.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 repetitions with good form. Increase the weight in subsequent sets if possible.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Adjust the cable machine to a comfortable height. Sit on the seat with your back straight. Grab the handles with a neutral grip.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit on the seat with your back straight. Grab the handles with a neutral grip. Extend your arms in front of you.
2. Fly the Handles: Slowly bring the handles together in front of you, squeezing your chest muscles.  Maintain a slight bend in your elbows.
3. Return to Start: Slowly return the handles to the starting position, feeling the stretch in your chest muscles.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and a controlled pace.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 repetitions with good form. Increase the weight in subsequent sets if possible.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a controlled movement throughout the entire range of motion. Avoid using momentum to lift the weight.

exercises.setup: Sit on the cable fly machine with your back straight and feet flat on the floor. Grab the handles with a neutral grip.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit on the seat with your back straight. Grab the handles with a neutral grip. Extend your arms in front of you.
2. Fly the Handles: Slowly bring the handles together in front of you, squeezing your chest muscles.  Maintain a slight bend in your elbows.
3. Return to Start: Slowly return the handles to the starting position, feeling the stretch in your chest muscles.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and a controlled pace.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 repetitions with good form. Increase the weight in subsequent sets if possible.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other. Extend your arms to the sides.
2. Fly the Dumbbells: Slowly bring the dumbbells together above your chest, squeezing your chest muscles.  Maintain a slight bend in your elbows.
3. Return to Start: Slowly return the dumbbells to the starting position, feeling the stretch in your chest muscles.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and a controlled pace.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 repetitions with good form. Increase the weight in subsequent sets if possible.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on the mind-muscle connection.  Feel the stretch in your chest muscles at the bottom of the movement and the contraction at the top.

exercises.setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with a narrow grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width. Lower the bar to your chest.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with a narrow grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width. Lower the bar to your chest.
2. Lower the Bar: Slowly lower the barbell to your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.  Touch your chest with the bar.
3. Press the Bar: Extend your arms to press the barbell back up to the starting position.  Squeeze your triceps at the top of the movement.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and a controlled pace.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 repetitions with good form. Increase the weight in subsequent sets if possible.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Attach a straight bar to a cable machine. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart. Grip the bar with an overhand grip.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart. Grip the bar with an overhand grip. Extend your arms.
2. Lower the Bar: Slowly lower the bar towards your thighs, keeping your elbows close to your body.  Maintain tension in your triceps.
3. Extend the Arms: Extend your arms to bring the bar back to the starting position.  Squeeze your triceps at the top of the movement.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and a controlled pace.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 repetitions with good form. Increase the weight in subsequent sets if possible.
exercises.additional_tips: Keep your elbows close to your body throughout the movement. Avoid swinging your arms.

exercises.setup: Position the cable at a low setting and use a bar attachment. Stand facing away from the cable machine with arms overhead.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand facing away from the cable machine with arms overhead. Grab the bar attachment with an overhand grip.
2. Lower the Bar: Slowly lower the bar behind your head by bending your elbows.  Keep your upper arms close to your ears.
3. Extend the Arms: Extend your arms to bring the bar back to the starting position.  Squeeze your triceps at the top of the movement.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and a controlled pace.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 repetitions with good form. Increase the weight in subsequent sets if possible.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width. Lower the bar towards your forehead.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width. Lower the bar towards your forehead.
2. Lower the Bar: Slowly lower the barbell towards your forehead by bending your elbows.  Keep your upper arms close to your ears.
3. Extend the Arms: Extend your arms to bring the bar back to the starting position.  Squeeze your triceps at the top of the movement.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and a controlled pace.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 repetitions with good form. Increase the weight in subsequent sets if possible.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on the mind-muscle connection.  Feel the stretch in your triceps at the bottom of the movement and the contraction at the top.

exercises.setup: Position the cable at a low setting and use a rope attachment. Stand facing away from the cable machine with arms overhead.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand facing away from the cable machine with arms overhead. Grab the rope attachment with an overhand grip.
2. Lower the Rope: Slowly lower the rope behind your head by bending your elbows.  Keep your upper arms close to your ears.
3. Extend the Arms: Extend your arms to bring the rope back to the starting position.  Squeeze your triceps at the top of the movement.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and a controlled pace.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 12 repetitions with good form. Increase the weight in subsequent sets if possible.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in one hand.  Rest your other hand on your thigh for support.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in one hand.  Rest your other hand on your thigh for support. Extend your arm.
2. Lower the Dumbbell: Slowly lower the dumbbell behind your head by bending your elbow.  Keep your upper arm close to your ear.
3. Extend the Arm: Extend your arm to bring the dumbbell back to the starting position.  Squeeze your triceps at the top of the movement.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions on one arm, then switch to the other arm.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 12 repetitions with good form. Increase the weight in subsequent sets if possible.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on the mind-muscle connection.  Feel the stretch in your triceps at the bottom of the movement and the contraction at the top.
